001package squidpony.squidai;
002
003import squidpony.squidgrid.Direction;
004import squidpony.squidgrid.Measurement;
005import squidpony.squidgrid.Radius;
006import squidpony.squidgrid.mapping.DungeonUtility;
007import squidpony.squidmath.*;
008
009import java.util.ArrayList;
010import java.util.Collections;
011import java.util.Map;
012
013import static squidpony.squidmath.CoordPacker.*;
014
015/**
016 * Pathfind to known connections between rooms or other "chokepoints" without needing full-map Dijkstra scans.
017 * Pre-calculates a path either from or to any given chokepoint to each other chokepoint.
018 * Created by Tommy Ettinger on 10/25/2015.
019 */
020public class WaypointPathfinder {
021    private int width;
022    private int height;
023    private DijkstraMap dm;
024    private int[][] expansionMap;
025    public StatefulRNG rng;
026    private OrderedMap<Coord, OrderedMap<Coord, Edge>> waypoints;
027
028    /**
029     * Calculates and stores the doors and doors-like connections ("chokepoints") on the given map as waypoints.
030     * Will use the given Radius enum to determine how to handle DijkstraMap measurement in future pathfinding.
031     * Uses a new RNG for all random choices, which will be seeded with {@code rng.nextLong()}, or unseeded if
032     * the parameter is null.
033     * @param map a char[][] that stores a "complete" dungeon map, with any chars as features that pathfinding needs.
034     * @param measurement a Radius that should correspond to how you want path distance calculated.
035     * @param rng an RNG object or null (this will always use a new RNG, but it may be seeded by a given RNG's next result)
036     */
037    public WaypointPathfinder(char[][] map, Radius measurement, IRNG rng)
038    {
039        if(rng == null)
040            this.rng = new StatefulRNG();
041        else
042            this.rng = new StatefulRNG(rng.nextLong());
043        width = map.length;
044        height = map[0].length;
045        char[][] simplified = DungeonUtility.simplifyDungeon(map);
046        OrderedSet<Coord> centers = PoissonDisk.sampleMap(simplified,
047                Math.min(width, height) * 0.4f, this.rng, '#');
048        int centerCount = centers.size();
049        expansionMap = new int[width][height];
050        waypoints = new OrderedMap<>(64);
051        dm = new DijkstraMap(simplified, Measurement.MANHATTAN);
052
053        for (Coord center : centers) {
054            dm.clearGoals();
055            dm.resetMap();
056            dm.setGoal(center);
057            dm.scan(null, null);
058            double current;
059            for (int i = 0; i < width; i++) {
060                for (int j = 0; j < height; j++) {
061                    current = dm.gradientMap[i][j];
062                    if (current >= DijkstraMap.FLOOR)
063                        continue;
064                    if (center.x == i && center.y == j)
065                        expansionMap[i][j]++;
066                    for (Direction dir : Direction.CARDINALS) {
067                        if (dm.gradientMap[i + dir.deltaX][j + dir.deltaY] == current + 1 ||
068                                dm.gradientMap[i + dir.deltaX][j + dir.deltaY] == current - 1)
069                            expansionMap[i][j]++;
070                    }
071                }
072            }
073        }
074
075        for (int i = 0; i < width; i++) {
076            for (int j = 0; j < height; j++) {
077                expansionMap[i][j] /= centerCount;
078            }
079        }
080
081        OrderedSet<Coord> chokes = new OrderedSet<>(128);
082        for (int i = 0; i < width; i++) {
083            ELEMENT_WISE:
084            for (int j = 0; j < height; j++) {
085                if(expansionMap[i][j] <= 0)
086                    continue;
087                int current = expansionMap[i][j];
088                boolean good = false;
089                for(Direction dir : Direction.CARDINALS) {
090                    if (chokes.contains(Coord.get(i + dir.deltaX, j + dir.deltaY)))
091                        continue ELEMENT_WISE;
092                    if (expansionMap[i + dir.deltaX][j + dir.deltaY] > 0 && expansionMap[i + dir.deltaX][j + dir.deltaY] > current + 1 ||
093                            (expansionMap[i + dir.deltaX][j + dir.deltaY] > current && expansionMap[i][j] <= 2)) {
094                        if (expansionMap[i - dir.deltaX][j - dir.deltaY] > 0 && expansionMap[i - dir.deltaX][j - dir.deltaY] >= current) {
095                            good = true;
096                        }
097                    }
098                }
099
100                if(good) {
101                    Coord chk = Coord.get(i, j);
102                    chokes.add(chk);
103                    waypoints.put(chk, new OrderedMap<Coord, Edge>());
104                }
105            }
106        }
107        
108        dm = new DijkstraMap(map, DijkstraMap.findMeasurement(measurement));
109
110        for(Map.Entry<Coord, OrderedMap<Coord, Edge>> n : waypoints.entrySet())
111        {
112            chokes.remove(n.getKey());
113            if(chokes.isEmpty())
114                break;
115            dm.clearGoals();
116            dm.resetMap();
117            dm.setGoal(n.getKey());
118            dm.scan(null, null);
119            for(Coord c : chokes)
120            {
121                n.getValue().put(c, new Edge(n.getKey(), c, dm.findPathPreScanned(c), dm.gradientMap[c.x][c.y]));
122            }
123        }
124
125    }
126    /**
127     * Calculates and stores the doors and doors-like connections ("chokepoints") on the given map as waypoints.
128     * Will use the given Radius enum to determine how to handle DijkstraMap measurement in future pathfinding.
129     * Uses a new RNG for all random choices, which will be seeded with {@code rng.nextLong()}, or unseeded if
130     * the parameter is null.
131     * @param map a char[][] that stores a "complete" dungeon map, with any chars as features that pathfinding needs.
132     * @param measurement a Radius that should correspond to how you want path distance calculated.
133     * @param rng an RNG object or null (this will always use a new RNG, but it may be seeded by a given RNG's next result)
134     * @param thickCorridors true if most chokepoints on the map are 2 cells wide instead of 1
135     */
136    public WaypointPathfinder(char[][] map, Radius measurement, IRNG rng, boolean thickCorridors)
137    {
138        if(rng == null)
139            this.rng = new StatefulRNG();
140        else
141            this.rng = new StatefulRNG(rng.nextLong());
142        width = map.length;
143        height = map[0].length;
144        char[][] simplified = DungeonUtility.simplifyDungeon(map);
145        expansionMap = new int[width][height];
146        waypoints = new OrderedMap<>(64);
147        OrderedSet<Coord> chokes = new OrderedSet<>(128);
148
149        if(thickCorridors)
150        {
151            short[] floors = pack(simplified, '.'),
152                    rooms = flood(floors, retract(floors, 1, 60, 60, true), 2, false),
153                    corridors = differencePacked(floors, rooms),
154                    doors = intersectPacked(rooms, fringe(corridors, 1, 60, 60, false));
155            Coord[] apart = apartPacked(doors, 1);
156            Collections.addAll(chokes, apart);
157            for (int i = 0; i < apart.length; i++) {
158                waypoints.put(apart[i], new OrderedMap<Coord, Edge>());
159            }
160        }
161        else {
162            OrderedSet<Coord> centers = PoissonDisk.sampleMap(simplified,
163                    Math.min(width, height) * 0.4f, this.rng, '#');
164            int centerCount = centers.size();
165            dm = new DijkstraMap(simplified, Measurement.MANHATTAN);
166
167            for (Coord center : centers) {
168                dm.clearGoals();
169                dm.resetMap();
170                dm.setGoal(center);
171                dm.scan(null, null);
172                double current;
173                for (int i = 0; i < width; i++) {
174                    for (int j = 0; j < height; j++) {
175                        current = dm.gradientMap[i][j];
176                        if (current >= DijkstraMap.FLOOR)
177                            continue;
178                        if (center.x == i && center.y == j)
179                            expansionMap[i][j]++;
180                        for (Direction dir : Direction.CARDINALS) {
181                            if (dm.gradientMap[i + dir.deltaX][j + dir.deltaY] == current + 1 ||
182                                    dm.gradientMap[i + dir.deltaX][j + dir.deltaY] == current - 1)
183                                expansionMap[i][j]++;
184                        }
185                    }
186                }
187            }
188
189            for (int i = 0; i < width; i++) {
190                for (int j = 0; j < height; j++) {
191                    expansionMap[i][j] /= centerCount;
192                }
193            }
194
195            for (int i = 0; i < width; i++) {
196                ELEMENT_WISE:
197                for (int j = 0; j < height; j++) {
198                    if (expansionMap[i][j] <= 0)
199                        continue;
200                    int current = expansionMap[i][j];
201                    boolean good = false;
202                    for (Direction dir : Direction.CARDINALS) {
203                        if (chokes.contains(Coord.get(i + dir.deltaX, j + dir.deltaY)))
204                            continue ELEMENT_WISE;
205                        if (expansionMap[i + dir.deltaX][j + dir.deltaY] > 0 && expansionMap[i + dir.deltaX][j + dir.deltaY] > current + 1 ||
206                                (expansionMap[i + dir.deltaX][j + dir.deltaY] > current && expansionMap[i][j] <= 2)) {
207                            if (expansionMap[i - dir.deltaX][j - dir.deltaY] > 0 && expansionMap[i - dir.deltaX][j - dir.deltaY] >= current) {
208                                good = true;
209                            }
210                        }
211                    }
212
213                    if (good) {
214                        Coord chk = Coord.get(i, j);
215                        chokes.add(chk);
216                        waypoints.put(chk, new OrderedMap<Coord, Edge>());
217                    }
218                }
219            }
220        }
221
222        dm = new DijkstraMap(map, DijkstraMap.findMeasurement(measurement));
223
224        int e = 0;
225        for(Map.Entry<Coord, OrderedMap<Coord, Edge>> n : waypoints.entrySet())
226        {
227            chokes.remove(n.getKey());
228            if(chokes.isEmpty())
229                break;
230            dm.clearGoals();
231            dm.resetMap();
232            dm.setGoal(n.getKey());
233            dm.scan(null, null);
234            for(Coord c : chokes)
235            {
236                n.getValue().put(c, new Edge(n.getKey(), c, dm.findPathPreScanned(c), dm.gradientMap[c.x][c.y]));
237            }
238        }
239
240    }
241
242    /**
243     * Calculates and stores the specified fraction of walkable points from map as waypoints. Does not perform any
244     * analysis of chokepoints and acts as a more brute-force solution when maps may be unpredictable. The lack of an
245     * analysis step may mean this could have drastically less of a penalty to startup time than the other constructors,
246     * and with the right fraction parameter (29 seems ideal), may perform better as well. Will use the given Radius
247     * enum to determine how to handle DijkstraMap measurement in future pathfinding.
248     * Uses a new RNG for all random choices, which will be seeded with {@code rng.nextLong()}, or unseeded if
249     * the parameter is null.
250     * <br>
251     * Remember, a fraction value of 29 works well!
252     * @param map a char[][] that stores a "complete" dungeon map, with any chars as features that pathfinding needs.
253     * @param measurement a Radius that should correspond to how you want path distance calculated.
254     * @param rng an RNG object or null (this will always use a new RNG, but it may be seeded by a given RNG's next result)
255     * @param fraction the fractional denominator of passable cells to assign as waypoints; use 29 if you aren't sure
256     */
257    public WaypointPathfinder(char[][] map, Radius measurement, IRNG rng, int fraction)
258    {
259        if(rng == null)
260            this.rng = new StatefulRNG();
261        else
262            this.rng = new StatefulRNG(rng.nextLong());
263        width = map.length;
264        height = map[0].length;
265        char[][] simplified = DungeonUtility.simplifyDungeon(map);
266        expansionMap = new int[width][height];
267        waypoints = new OrderedMap<>(64);
268        OrderedSet<Coord> chokes = new OrderedSet<>(128);
269
270        short[] floors = pack(simplified, '.');
271        Coord[] apart = fractionPacked(floors, fraction);
272        Collections.addAll(chokes, apart);
273        for (int i = 0; i < apart.length; i++) {
274            waypoints.put(apart[i], new OrderedMap<Coord, Edge>());
275        }
276
277        dm = new DijkstraMap(map, DijkstraMap.findMeasurement(measurement));
278
279        int e = 0;
280        for(Map.Entry<Coord, OrderedMap<Coord, Edge>> n : waypoints.entrySet())
281        {
282            chokes.remove(n.getKey());
283            if(chokes.isEmpty())
284                break;
285            dm.clearGoals();
286            dm.resetMap();
287            dm.setGoal(n.getKey());
288            dm.scan(null, null);
289            for(Coord c : chokes)
290            {
291                n.getValue().put(c, new Edge(n.getKey(), c, dm.findPathPreScanned(c), dm.gradientMap[c.x][c.y]));
292            }
293        }
294
295    }
296
297    /**
298     * Calculates and stores the doors and doors-like connections ("chokepoints") on the given map as waypoints.
299     * Will use the given DijkstraMap for pathfinding after construction (and during some initial calculations).
300     * The dijkstra parameter will be mutated by this class, so it should not be reused elsewhere.
301     * Uses a new RNG for all random choices, which will be seeded with {@code rng.nextLong()}, or unseeded if
302     * the parameter is null.
303     * @param map a char[][] that stores a "complete" dungeon map, with any chars as features that pathfinding needs
304     * @param dijkstra a DijkstraMap that will be used to find paths; may have costs but they will not be used
305     * @param rng an RNG object or null (this will always use a new RNG, but it may be seeded by a given RNG's next result)
306     */
307    public WaypointPathfinder(char[][] map, DijkstraMap dijkstra, IRNG rng)
308    {
309        if(rng == null)
310            this.rng = new StatefulRNG();
311        else
312            this.rng = new StatefulRNG(rng.nextLong());
313        width = map.length;
314        height = map[0].length;
315        char[][] simplified = DungeonUtility.simplifyDungeon(map);
316        OrderedSet<Coord> centers = PoissonDisk.sampleMap(simplified,
317                Math.min(width, height) * 0.4f, this.rng, '#');
318        int centerCount = centers.size();
319        expansionMap = new int[width][height];
320        waypoints = new OrderedMap<>(64);
321        dm = new DijkstraMap(simplified, Measurement.MANHATTAN);
322
323        for (Coord center : centers) {
324            dm.clearGoals();
325            dm.resetMap();
326            dm.setGoal(center);
327            dm.scan(null, null);
328            double current;
329            for (int i = 0; i < width; i++) {
330                for (int j = 0; j < height; j++) {
331                    current = dm.gradientMap[i][j];
332                    if (current >= DijkstraMap.FLOOR)
333                        continue;
334                    if (center.x == i && center.y == j)
335                        expansionMap[i][j]++;
336                    for (Direction dir : Direction.CARDINALS) {
337                        if (dm.gradientMap[i + dir.deltaX][j + dir.deltaY] == current + 1 ||
338                                dm.gradientMap[i + dir.deltaX][j + dir.deltaY] == current - 1)
339                            expansionMap[i][j]++;
340                    }
341                }
342            }
343        }
344
345        for (int i = 0; i < width; i++) {
346            for (int j = 0; j < height; j++) {
347                expansionMap[i][j] /= centerCount;
348            }
349        }
350
351        OrderedSet<Coord> chokes = new OrderedSet<>(128);
352        for (int i = 0; i < width; i++) {
353            ELEMENT_WISE:
354            for (int j = 0; j < height; j++) {
355                if(expansionMap[i][j] <= 0)
356                    continue;
357                int current = expansionMap[i][j];
358                boolean good = false;
359                for(Direction dir : Direction.CARDINALS) {
360                    if (chokes.contains(Coord.get(i + dir.deltaX, j + dir.deltaY)))
361                        continue ELEMENT_WISE;
362                    if (expansionMap[i + dir.deltaX][j + dir.deltaY] > 0 && expansionMap[i + dir.deltaX][j + dir.deltaY] > current + 1 ||
363                            (expansionMap[i + dir.deltaX][j + dir.deltaY] > current && expansionMap[i][j] <= 2)) {
364                        if (expansionMap[i - dir.deltaX][j - dir.deltaY] > 0 && expansionMap[i - dir.deltaX][j - dir.deltaY] >= current) {
365                            good = true;
366                        }
367                    }
368                }
369                if(good) {
370                    Coord chk = Coord.get(i, j);
371                    chokes.add(chk);
372                    waypoints.put(chk, new OrderedMap<Coord, Edge>());
373                }
374            }
375        }
376        dm = dijkstra;
377        int e = 0;
378        for(Map.Entry<Coord, OrderedMap<Coord, Edge>> n : waypoints.entrySet())
379        {
380            chokes.remove(n.getKey());
381            if(chokes.isEmpty())
382                break;
383            dm.clearGoals();
384            dm.resetMap();
385            dm.setGoal(n.getKey());
386            dm.scan(null, null);
387            for(Coord c : chokes)
388            {
389                n.getValue().put(c, new Edge(n.getKey(), c, dm.findPathPreScanned(c), dm.gradientMap[c.x][c.y]));
390            }
391        }
392
393    }
394
395    /**
396     * Finds the appropriate one of the already-calculated, possibly-long paths this class stores to get from a waypoint
397     * to another waypoint, then quickly finds a path to get on the long path, and returns the total path. This does
398     * not need to perform any full-map scans with DijkstraMap.
399     * @param self the pathfinder's position
400     * @param approximateTarget the Coord that represents the approximate area to pathfind to; will be randomized if
401     *                          it is not walkable.
402     * @return an ArrayList of Coord that will go from a cell adjacent to self to a waypoint near approximateTarget
403     */
404    public ArrayList<Coord> getKnownPath(Coord self, Coord approximateTarget) {
405        ArrayList<Coord> near = dm.findNearestMultiple(approximateTarget, 5, waypoints.keySet());
406        Coord me = dm.findNearest(self, waypoints.keySet());
407        double bestCost = 999999.0;
408        ArrayList<Coord> path = new ArrayList<>();
409        /*if (waypoints.containsKey(me)) {
410            Edge[] ed = waypoints.get(me).values().toArray(new Edge[waypoints.get(me).size()]);
411            Arrays.sort(ed);
412            path = ed[0].path;
413        */
414        boolean reversed = false;
415        for (Coord test : near) {
416            if (waypoints.containsKey(test)) {
417                Edge ed;
418                if(waypoints.get(test).containsKey(me)) {
419                    ed = waypoints.get(test).get(me);
420                    reversed = true;
421                }
422                else if(waypoints.containsKey(me) && waypoints.get(me).containsKey(test))
423                    ed = waypoints.get(me).get(test);
424                else
425                    continue;
426                if (ed.cost < bestCost) {
427                    bestCost = ed.cost;
428                    path = new ArrayList<>(ed.path);
429                }
430            }
431        }
432        if(path.isEmpty())
433            return path;
434        if(reversed)
435            Collections.reverse(path);
436        ArrayList<Coord> getToPath = dm.findShortcutPath(self, path.toArray(new Coord[0]));
437        if (getToPath.size() > 0)
438        {
439            getToPath.remove(getToPath.size() - 1);
440            getToPath.addAll(path);
441            path = getToPath;
442        }
443        return path;
444    }
445
446    /**
447     * If a creature is interrupted or obstructed on a "highway" path, it may need to travel off the path to its goal.
448     * This method gets a straight-line path back to the path to goal. It does not contain the "highway" path, only the
449     * "on-ramp" to enter the ideal path.
450     * @param currentPosition the current position of the pathfinder, which is probably not on the ideal path
451     * @param path the ideal path, probably returned by getKnownPath
452     * @return an ArrayList of Coord that go from a cell adjacent to currentPosition to a Coord on or adjacent to path.
453     */
454    public ArrayList<Coord> goBackToPath(Coord currentPosition, ArrayList<Coord> path)
455    {
456        return dm.findShortcutPath(currentPosition, path.toArray(new Coord[0]));
457    }
458
459    public OrderedSet<Coord> getWaypoints()
460    {
461        return waypoints.keysAsOrderedSet();
462    }
463
464    private static class Edge implements Comparable<Edge>
465    {
466        public Coord from;
467        public Coord to;
468        public ArrayList<Coord> path;
469        public double cost;
470        public Edge(Coord from, Coord to, ArrayList<Coord> path, double cost)
471        {
472            this.from = from;
473            this.to = to;
474            this.path = path;
475            this.cost = cost;
476        }
477
478        @Override
479        public boolean equals(Object o) {
480            if (this == o) return true;
481            if (o == null || getClass() != o.getClass()) return false;
482
483            Edge edge = (Edge) o;
484
485            if (Double.compare(edge.cost, cost) != 0) return false;
486            if (!from.equals(edge.from)) return false;
487            return to.equals(edge.to);
488
489        }
490
491        @Override
492        public int hashCode() {
493            int result;
494            long temp;
495            result = from.hashCode();
496            result = 31 * result + to.hashCode();
497            temp = NumberTools.doubleToLongBits(cost);
498            result = 31 * result + (int) (temp ^ (temp >>> 32));
499            return result;
500        }
501
502        /**
503         * Compares this object with the specified object for order.  Returns a
504         * negative integer, zero, or a positive integer as this object is less
505         * than, equal to, or greater than the specified object.
506         *
507         * Note: this class has a natural ordering that is
508         * inconsistent with equals.
509         * @param o the object to be compared.
510         * @return a negative integer, zero, or a positive integer as this object
511         * is less than, equal to, or greater than the specified object.
512         * @throws NullPointerException if the specified object is null
513         * @throws ClassCastException   if the specified object's type prevents it
514         *                              from being compared to this object.
515         */
516        @Override
517        public int compareTo(Edge o) {
518            return (cost - o.cost > 0) ? 1 : (cost - o.cost < 0) ? -1 : 0;
519        }
520    }
521
522}
